title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Help me fix my wifes A-1297 that has green light on charger, fan spin for about 5 seconds, then it shutsdown, the CPU and GPU get very hot very quick. I changed out the 216-0810005 GPU with a "new" one I got from china, but of course same issue. Cant seem to find a short to ground but its possible I missed it somewhere. [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Any ideas on where to start again with this?[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Thanks![/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Also, there is no Chime or video of course.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
Any reason this happened? 
What is CPU Vcore?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
PPVCORE_S0_CPU = 1.09 volts before it overheats and shuts down

The computer was doing the usual overheating and shutdown and occasional pinkish vertical lines...so I knew it was getting time to replace the GPU.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: It was time to take it to Apple for a free fix. Now it is messed up, probably bad chip or soldering.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: No it was doing this before I soldered it. Sounds like this is the end of my help.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Please,......anyone beside dukesfawks might help me? I will measure anything you ask. Up for any hints!!

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: It's not the end of my help, but if you cannot confirm you got a good chip and it was soldered correctly then I have no idea what to troubleshoot.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: This board belongs at Apple for replacement under warranty, just clean up the flux and go from there. 216-0810005 you find will mostly be reballed trash or fake.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
Apple will not accept it if it is not able to boot VST. Board needs to at least turn on and chime....
Maybe Apple USA is less picky about it, but here in NL I cannot get it fixed without it at least be able to boot AST.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Measure voltages on L9510 and L9560 before it shuts down.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
L9560
PP1V5_SOGPU_ISNS_R side = 1.43v
P1V5FB_LL = 1.34v

L9510 
P1V0GPU_LL = .64v
PP1V0_S0GPU_ISNS_R = .97v

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: That seems right, so nothing easy. Does it also shut down when RAM is removed?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 6184"]This board belongs at Apple for replacement under warranty, just clean up the flux and go from there. 216-0810005 you find will mostly be reballed trash or fake. [/QUOTE]


Thanks Lewis. The board starting doing what it is doing now before I removed the old 216-0810005 and put the new one on with the rework station. My hope was the problem was related as the GPU was going south, but it seems the problem isn't that. Now once I get it to boot if there are ANY video probs, I will try to take it to the apple store, but I live in Hong Kong, China, a place that is not known for having any customer service at all. I would be blown away if anyone at apple would help me.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6197"]That seems right, so nothing easy. Does it also shut down when RAM is removed?[/QUOTE]

Just did a test, behavior is the same with or without the ram

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: both the GPU and CPU(and only those two) get hot enough to burn my finger within a few seconds of being on. Can you guys think of a power rail that is shared between the two that could be shorted?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Are you trying this thing without a heat sink? If yes, does it stay on longer with the heat sink? No there is no shared power rail between GPU/CPU.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Yes with the heatsink on it stays on a good while, the fan speeds up RPM too...still not hearing a chime

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: At this point we do not know if the GPU is good or soldered good. I'm pretty sure these boards will boot without a GPU, so go ahead and remove it and see what it does.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Well I put it back together and in its case, and it turns on, I get a 3 beep and no screen or chime.. I tried reseating the ram in various ways, didn't seem to help

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: 3 beeps is always a RAM error. Maybe a bad sick maybe a bad slot. Try one stick at a time and try one slot at a time. Should be PC10600 RAM.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
hmm one stick at a time and one slot at a time, get the same beeps...

using this ram: [url]http://www.corsair.com/en/corsair-memory-16gb-2-x-8gb-ddr3-sodimm-memory-cmso16gx3m2a1333c9[/url]

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Are you getting 1.5V on L7330?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
L7330
PPDDR_S3_REG_R side 1.43v
DDRREG_VSW side 1.20v

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: I"m getting no voltage on L7550, is that normal?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
L7550 will only get power once the board initializes the video. 
What is the resistance to GND on L7330, 1.43V is too low so it may be loaded down.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
L7330 resistance about 4.7K
I checked with my better multimeter, and it seems my other is low. I just remeasured 1.49v

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: Get a DDR3 memory slot tester to see if any data lines are broken. Although at this point I'm suspecting a bad CPU. What rework station did you use to change the GPU?

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message:
It was a Chinese cheapo station here belongs to a friend of a friend. So you think it might have burnt the CPU? I'll look for a mem slot tester.

I'm not familar with CPU replacement on these macbooks. I also dont see any for sale using the part number off this board. Is this a bad avenue to go down? Time for board replacement?

Thanks for all your help.

title: 820-2914-B Brief startup then shutdown
message: You destroyed a $600 board with a garbage rework station. When I have a machine with an unrepairable board it is end of the line. No way these machines are worth spending $600 on a board. Dump the whole thing on Ebay and cut your losses. Next time take stuff to Apple
